Generate an IELTS Speaking Part 2 cue card topic about friend.
fields.cue_card_points:
Format:
Main question: Describe a [topic]...
You should say:
• [point 1]
• [point 2]
• [point 3]
• and explain [point 4]
Topic: Describe a friend you have had for a long time.
Main question: Describe a friend you have had for a long time.
You should say:
• Who this friend is
• How long you have known this friend
• What you enjoy doing together
• And explain why this friendship is important to you
Example:
I'd like to talk about my best friend, John. He's a guy I've known since we were in elementary school together. We met when we were six years old and have been inseparable ever since.
John and I have always had a lot in common. We both love sports, especially soccer, and we used to play on the same team growing up. We also both enjoy watching movies and going to the cinema together. In fact, we have a tradition of seeing every new Star Wars movie on opening night.
What I appreciate most about John, though, is his sense of humor and his ability to make me laugh. He always knows how to lighten the mood and make me feel better when I'm down.
This friendship is important to me because it's a constant in my life. No matter where I go or what I do, I know that John will be there for me. We've been through a lot together – good times and bad – and I feel grateful to have him as a friend.
So, that's a description of my long-time friend, John. I value our friendship and cherish the memories we've made together.

Generate an IELTS Speaking Part 2 cue card topic about role model.
fields.cue_card_points:
Format:
Main question: Describe a [topic]...
You should say:
• [point 1]
• [point 2]
• [point 3]
• and explain [point 4]
Topic: Describe a person who is a role model for you and explain why.
Main question: Describe a person who is a role model for you and explain why.
You should say:
• Who this person is
• What qualities they have that you admire
• How they have influenced you
• And explain why they are important to you
Example:
I'd like to talk about my grandfather, who is a role model for me. He was a doctor and he dedicated his entire life to helping people.
Firstly, he was an incredibly kind and compassionate person. He always put others before himself and went out of his way to make people feel better, whether it was through his medical work or just by listening to them.
Secondly, he had an incredible work ethic. He would work long hours, often into the night, to ensure that his patients received the best possible care. He never complained about the long hours or the difficult cases, and he always had a positive attitude.
Thirdly, he had a great sense of humor and was always able to find the bright side of things. Even in the most difficult situations, he would find a way to make people laugh and lighten the mood.
Fourthly, he was a true inspiration to me. I grew up watching him and learning from him, and I can only hope to be as kind, compassionate, and hardworking as he was. He passed away a few years ago, but his memory and the lessons he taught me continue to inspire me every day.
So, that's who my role model is and why he is important to me. Thank you.

Generate an IELTS Speaking Part 2 cue card topic about family member.
fields.cue_card_points:
Format:
Main question: Describe a [topic]...
You should say:
• [point 1]
• [point 2]
• [point 3]
• and explain [point 4]
Topic: Describe a family member who has influenced you the most.
Main question: Describe a family member who has influenced you the most.
You should say:
• Who this person is
• How old they were when you met them
• What they did that influenced you
• And explain why their influence was so strong
Sample answer:
I'd like to talk about my grandmother, who has had the most significant impact on my life. She was born in the 1930s and I met her when I was just a toddler. My grandmother was a remarkable woman, always full of energy and kindness.
One of the things that influenced me the most about my grandmother was her strong work ethic. She was a farmer and worked tirelessly in the fields every day, come rain or shine. She taught me the value of hard work and the importance of perseverance. I remember watching her work in the fields, and even as a child, I was inspired by her determination and her ability to never give up.
Another thing that made a deep impression on me was her kindness and generosity. She was always there for her family and her community, ready to lend a helping hand whenever someone needed it. She taught me the importance of being kind to others and of putting the needs of others before my own. Her selflessness and compassion have stayed with me throughout my life, and I try to emulate her in my own interactions with others.
Lastly, my grandmother was a woman of great wisdom and insight. She had a deep understanding of human nature and was always able to offer sage advice when I needed it. Her words of wisdom have stayed with me, and I often find myself reflecting on the lessons she taught me.
In conclusion, my grandmother has been the family member who has influenced me the most. Her strong work ethic, kindness, generosity, and wisdom have all left a deep and lasting impression on me. I am grateful for the time I spent with her and for the lessons she taught me. Her influence has shaped me into the person I am today, and I will always cherish the memories I have of her.

Generate an IELTS Speaking Part 2 cue card topic about park.
fields.cue_card_points:
Format:
Main question: Describe a [topic]...
You should say:
• [point 1]
• [point 2]
• [point 3]
• and explain [point 4]
Topic: Describe a park you like.
Main question: Describe a park you like.
You should say:
• Which park I like
• Why I like this park
• What activities I can do there
• And explain the atmosphere of the park
Sample answer:
Which park I like:
There is a beautiful park located near my house, which I visit quite frequently. It's called Central Park, and it's one of the most popular parks in our city.
Why I like this park:
I like this park for several reasons. Firstly, it's a large park with plenty of greenery, making it an ideal place to relax and unwind. Secondly, it has a lake in the center, which is a great spot for picnics, boating, and fishing. Lastly, there are several walking and biking trails, which are perfect for those who enjoy outdoor activities.
What activities I can do there:
There are several activities that I can do in this park. As I mentioned earlier, I enjoy having picnics by the lake. Additionally, I can go for a leisurely walk or bike ride on the trails. During the summer months, I also enjoy playing frisbee or soccer with my friends. And during the winter, I like to go ice-skating on the frozen lake.
And explain the atmosphere of the park:
The atmosphere of the park is always lively and vibrant. During the day, you can see families having picnics, children playing on the swings, and people walking their dogs. In the evenings, the park transforms into a peaceful and serene place, with people sitting on the benches, reading books or just enjoying the tranquility of the park. Overall, Central Park is a place where people of all ages and backgrounds can come together and enjoy the beauty of nature.

Generate an IELTS Speaking Part 2 cue card topic about tourist spot.
fields.cue_card_points:
Format:
Main question: Describe a [topic]...
You should say:
• [point 1]
• [point 2]
• [point 3]
• and explain [point 4]
Topic: Describe a famous tourist spot in your country.
Model answer:
Main question: Describe a famous tourist spot in your country.
You know, my country, Thailand, is famous for its beautiful temples, delicious food, and stunning beaches. But if I have to pick just one tourist spot to describe, I would definitely choose the Grand Palace in Bangkok.
Firstly, the Grand Palace is a historic site located in the heart of Bangkok. It was built in 1782 and has been the official residence of the Kings of Siam since then. The palace complex consists of numerous buildings, including the Temple of the Emerald Buddha, the Royal Reception Hall, and the Coronation Hall.
Secondly, the Grand Palace is a symbol of Thai culture and history. It is a must-visit destination for both local and international tourists. The intricate designs and gold decorations on the buildings are truly breathtaking. The temple complex is also home to many cultural events and ceremonies, such as the Royal Cremation Ceremony and the Songkran Festival.
Thirdly, the Grand Palace is surrounded by beautiful gardens and ponds, which add to its charm. The grounds are well-maintained, and visitors can take a leisurely stroll around the palace complex, enjoying the peaceful surroundings.
Lastly, it's important to note that there are some rules and etiquette that visitors should follow when visiting the Grand Palace. For example, visitors are required to dress appropriately, with shoulders and knees covered. Visitors are also not allowed to touch the statues or take photographs inside the temples. These rules are in place to respect the cultural significance of the site and to ensure the preservation of the historical buildings.
In conclusion, the Grand Palace in Bangkok is a famous tourist spot in Thailand that is rich in history, culture, and beauty. It is a must-visit destination for anyone traveling to Thailand, and I would highly recommend it to anyone who is interested in learning more about Thai history and culture.

fields.transcript: I would like to talk about my grandmother, who has had the most significant impact on my life. She was born in the 1930s and I met her when I was just to toddler. My grandmother was a remarkable woman, always full of energy and kindness. One of the things that influenced me the most about my grandmother was her strong work. He was a farmer, and she taught me the volume of hard work and the importance of her perseverance. I remember watching her work in the field. And when I asked a child, I was in peace by her determination and her ability to never give up.

fields.transcript: I'd like to talk about my father, who is a role model for me. He was a teacher and he dedicated his life to educating people. Firstly he was an incredible kind and compassionate person. He always put others before himself. He wanted all people to be educated. Secondly had an incredible work ethic. He would work long hours, often into the night. But he never complained about the long hours and difficult work. Thirdly he had a great sense of humour. And always was able to find the bright side of things. Firstly he was a true inspiration to me. He was the first educated man in his family. And he was the director of school. And his school was the best because of his work.

fields.transcript: I live in Uzbekistan and the four seasons come very differently in our country. Though I really like spring because in this time of the year it is really good. It's rainy sometimes however the weather is very good and well in mild. It's not that snowy or that cold or very hot. In this case I really like this season. I would say that winter is a very good one as well but it's really cold and in order to go outside we need to wear lots of clothes and I really don't wear that. When it comes to summer it's really hot and sometimes it really exhausts people. That's why I guess spring is the perfect season. Besides it has lots of trees glowing and lots of fruits come inside. So I guess this is the perfect season.

And the old part you can see the old and not good streets and homes."

Evaluation:
[Fluency/Coherence]: 6.0/9
- Speaker had some pauses and hesitations, particularly at the beginning of the response.
- The response was generally coherent, but the transition between the two parts of the town was not clear.

[Lexical Resource]: 6.5/9
- The speaker used some advanced vocabulary words, such as "historical" and "modern," but the response lacked variety and precision.
- The response could have been improved with more descriptive language and specific examples.

[Grammatical Range]: 6.5/9

- The response was generally grammatically correct, but the speaker could have used more complex sentence structures.

[Pronunciation]: 7.0/9
- The speaker's pronunciation was clear and understandable, but there were some minor errors, such as the pronunciation of "historical" and "not good."

[Overall Band Score]: 6.5/9
- The response lacked fluency, coherence, and lexical resource, which are essential components of a strong IELTS speaking performance.

[Detailed Feedback]:
- Use more descriptive language to paint a clearer picture of the town.
- Provide specific examples of modern buildings and old homes to make the response more detailed and interesting.
- Use more complex sentence structures to demonstrate a greater range of grammatical ability.
- Practice speaking fluently and coherently to improve overall performance.

[Tips for improvement]:
- Practice speaking in English as much as possible, ideally with native speakers or language partners.
- Listen to English music, watch English movies, and read English books to expand your vocabulary and improve your listening skills.
- Use language learning apps and resources to practice grammar and pronunciation.
- Focus on speaking fluently and coherently, rather than just memorizing vocabulary or grammar rules.
